description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5c0nb","text":"Here we describe a computational protocol for performing quality control analysis on shallow sequencing data obtained from 10X snRNA-seq experiments. The workflow starts with raw MiSeq run folders and uses cellranger to generate count matrices. The raw count matrices are analyzed and sequencing saturation plots are generated. The saturation plots are then compared against plots from a reference set of libraries with varying qualities (bad, fair, good, great), thus allowing for the determination of sequencing requirements as well as an assessment of the overall quality of each 10X snRNA experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"37rb6","text":"Install cellranger using instructions from https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/software/pipelines/latest/installation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":98}],"data":[]},{"key":"4vi56","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"paen","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"6mv98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"722A4102046411EDBE230A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://support.10xgenomics.com/single-cell-gene-expression/software/pipelines/latest/installation"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"729bd","text":"Make sure that cellranger is in the environment's path, otherwise modify commands to include the full path to cellranger.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fgu7s","text":"Install anaconda or miniconda Python distributions following given instructions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"92vvh","text":"Get anaconda from here: https://www.anaconda.com/products/distribution , OR","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":46}],"data":[]},{"key":"9nu96","text":"get miniconda from here: https://docs.conda.io/en/latest/miniconda.html","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":25,"length":46}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A3B10C63046411EDBE230A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.anaconda.com/products/distribution"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AD473856046411EDBE230A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://docs.conda.io/en/latest/miniconda.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eg37g","text":"Use conda to install bcl2fastq with the following terminal command:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70rtu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7db6r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"87j42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10598,"name":"conda install -c dranew bcl2fastq","os_name":"linux","os_version":null,"command_name":"install bcl2fastq","description":"This command installs bcl2fastq for demultiplexing Illumina sequencing runs.","can_edit":1,"guid":"E1ED0100046411EDA57E9DD1AA161510"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"84ht4","text":"Use conda to install required python packages with the following terminal command:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"80htv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"afmsp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10599,"name":"conda install -c conda-forge numpy seaborn matplotlib pandas","os_name":"linux","os_version":null,"command_name":"Install python packages for 10X_snRNA_preseq_analysis package","description":"This command installs required python packages for generating preseq plots for 10X_snRNA_preseq_analysis package","can_edit":1,"guid":"5C4299B0046511EDA57E9DD1AA161510"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ecubu","text":"Run cellranger mkfastq to generate fastq files. Make sure that the following placeholders are set to the correct paths and desired names.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"98cre","text":"\u003cFASTQ_OUT\u003e is the name of the output folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4rn2k","text":"\u003cRUN\u003e is the path to the MiSeq run folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dtuqc","text":"\u003cCSV\u003e is the path to the sample-sheet.csv file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"r2ov","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bs2ht","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"aus62","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10600,"name":"cellranger mkfastq --id=\u003cFASTQ_OUT\u003e --run=\u003cRUN\u003e --sample-sheet=\u003cCSV\u003e","os_name":"linux","os_version":null,"command_name":"Generate fastq files from raw run folders","description":"This command generates cellranger mkfastq results.","can_edit":1,"guid":"F328B520046611EDA57E9DD1AA161510"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"796kc","text":"Run cellranger count. Make sure that the following placeholders are set to the correct paths and desired names.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"evkbo","text":"\u003cID\u003e is the name of the output folder for the sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"400ua","text":"\u003cSAMPLE\u003e is the sample name used for the sample in the sample-sheet.csv file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cvkba","text":"\u003cREF\u003e is the path to the cellranger reference data folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4cqig","text":"\u003cNUM\u003e is the number of expected cells from the experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6hdor","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dad37","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"322sf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1q3ai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2uun1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10601,"name":"cellranger count --id \u003cID\u003e --fastqs \u003cFASTQ_OUT\u003e --sample \u003cSAMPLE\u003e --transcriptome \u003cREF\u003e --include-introns --expect-cells \u003cNUM\u003e","os_name":"linux","os_version":null,"command_name":"Generate the count matrix","description":"This command generates cellranger count results.","can_edit":1,"guid":"2A532550046A11EDA57E9DD1AA161510"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eq1qc","text":"Run the preseq script in the folder downloaded from this protocol. Make sure that the following placeholders are sset to the correct paths and names.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f0ci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cu8ba","text":"\u003cPATH_TO_FOLDER\u003e is the path to the folder that was extracted from the tar.gz file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1dh48","text":"\u003cID\u003e is the name of the output folder for the sample generated with cellranger.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cbsgl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4kurq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10602,"name":"\u003cPATH_TO_FOLDER\u003e/scripts/loop.preseq.r.sh \u003cID\u003e","os_name":"linux","os_version":null,"command_name":"Generate preseq plots from 10X snRNA output folder","description":"This command generates the preseq results for 10X snRNA experiments.","can_edit":1,"guid":"E945D090046811EDA57E9DD1AA161510"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd0th","text":"View outputs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e6v5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"as56v","text":"\u003cID\u003e.lc_extrap_log.txt contains preseq statistics","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2hrvc","text":"\u003cID\u003e.lc_extrap_output.png to view the sequencing saturation plots","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9h442","text":"\u003cID\u003e/outs/web_summary.html to view the cellranger analyses","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"beem9","text":"\u003cID\u003e/outs/summary.csv to view quality statistics generated by cellranger","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3cr0r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9raq8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ba5h6","text":"Preseq requires the GSL libraries. Install GSL using the instructions from https://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":33}],"data":{}},{"key":"2jusj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjalq","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3D8FD7E2079711EDA2FD0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.gnu.org/software/gsl"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ddrm","text":"Create a symbolic link so that preseq can find the required gsl library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn4rl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c6sv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":10603,"name":"sudo ln -s /usr/local/lib/libgsl.so /usr/lib/libgsl.so.0","os_name":"linux","os_version":null,"command_name":"Create a symbolic link to GSL library","description":"This command creates a symbolic link to a gsl library for preseq","can_edit":1,"guid":"96BF50D0079711EDB8494722CF678777"}}}}

title: Quality control analysis for 10X snRNA-seq
